section.name: Looping and Conditionals
section.p: Implemented 'if' statement - executes either a 'then' branch, or optional 'else' branch, based on truth value of 'test' attribute - which can be a groovy expression.
Implemented 'while' loop - executes body based on truth value of 'test' attribute.
Impleented 'for' loop - executes body for each item in a list - so like python & jelly for - sometimes called forEach.

section.name: Parallel Loop
section.p: Implemented and unit tested parallel-for-loop. This is similar to the for-loop (executes loop body for each item in a list), but in this case the loop bodies are executed potentially in parallel. That is, any calls to CEA applications will be fired off concurrently - other workflow activites are processed sequentially by the jes server.

A bit of a tricky one to implement - especially the treatment of variables and scopes - as there's many different values for the loop variable, all valid at the same time. Implememtation works by evaluating the list, and then uses the set of rules for the loop body as a template, from which new rules are generated for each loop branch. These rules are added to the rulestore, and then executed.
